summary: The Indian Health Service (IHS) funds health care for over 2 million American Indians and Alaska Natives. Currently, IHS receives its funding as part of the annual fiscal year appropriations cycle. Delays in passing appropriations create uncertainty and disrupt operations. For example, tribal representatives told us that such delays have led them to pay invoices late—hurting their relationship with a pharmaceutical vendor. We identified issues...
title: Indian Health Service: Considerations Related to Providing Advance Appropriation Authority
